intro: Pilosella longa, commonly known as the longleaf pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disk-like cluster. Pilosella longa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions.
